clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Investigated for use treatment in alpha 1 antitrypsin deficiency atopic dermatitis and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease COPD

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Alpha 1 antitrypsin is a glycoprotein primarily produced by hepatocytes and to a lesser extent immune system cells Recombinant alpha 1 antitrypsin rAAT is produced from yeast which unlike commercially available forms of plasma derived AAT eliminates the risk associated with blood borne infectious agents and allows for a increased manufacturing rAAT belongs to a family of structurally related proteins classified as serine protease inhibitors or SERPINS which are known to inhibit several proteases including trypsin cathepsin G thrombin tissue kallikrein as well as neutrophil elastase The proteinase antiproteinase balance is believed to be important for maintaining healthy skin
